intro: Henckelia macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant features upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
